intro: Hieracium coronopoides, commonly known as the crownflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its yellow or orange composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears the showy inflorescence. Hieracium coronopoides is often found in areas with full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
